page.title: 03HOUSING IN ELSTON
page.content: The{Darwin}family owned for many years much of the land around and within {Elston}village, as well as many of the cottages nearby and Elston Hall, which was the home of Charles Darwin's grandfather, Erasmus. However the Darwins, father and only son, were killed in the Second World War; the estate then passed to a daughter who disposed of it after the war. The land in the village was subsequently sold off piecemeal for housing, a development that was encouraged by the connection of domestic properties to the mains water supply in 1951,(until this date each house had its own or a shared pump) followed by the introduction of mains sewerage. The village has gas and electricity. Most of this development within the village is now completed.
